meanings.definition: The act of transferring ownership or control of a service or industry from private to municipal ownership.
meanings.sent1: The municipalization of the water supply led to better service for the residents.
meanings.sent2: Many cities have considered municipalization of their public transportation systems.
meanings.sent3: The municipalization of the garbage collection service made the town cleaner and more efficient.
meanings.sent4: The municipalization of the power grid was like bringing light to a dark room.
meanings.sent5: After the municipalization of the park maintenance, the green spaces flourished.

meanings.definition: The process of bringing under municipal control or ownership.
meanings.sent1: The municipalization of the library system improved access to books for everyone.
meanings.sent2: There was a debate in the town council about the municipalization of the local hospital.
meanings.sent3: The municipalization of the street cleaning service made the roads sparkle like never before.
meanings.sent4: For the town, the municipalization of the public pool was like diving into community spirit.
meanings.sent5: The municipalization of the public schools brought better resources to the students.
